thread.title: Andre Patton to test complete WR skills vs. No Fly Zone
thread.title_full: Andre Patton to test complete WR skills vs. No Fly Zone

author: app.com
title: Andre Patton to test complete WR skills vs. No Fly Zone
text:
MORE PISCATAWAY Andre Patton already knows the way to the end zone.
The junior wide receiver is learning the way to the first-down marker.
After proving he could make big plays in big games at the end of last season, Patton is showing that he doesn’t need to score touchdowns to make an impact on the game.
Take, for example, his five catches for 53 yards in the win against Kansas last time out.
“It’s something big because five catches shows I’m getting the ball and they are trusting me by putting the ball in my hands,” said Patton, who only has one career game with more catches. “It definitely boosts my confidence and makes me want to make more plays.”
All of Patton’s previous career highlights – recovering a blocked punt for a touchdown as a true freshman and a total of three touchdown catches in the 2013 and 2014 regular-season finales plus another one in the 2014 Quick Lane Bowl – involved putting points on the scoreboard.
Points lead to wins, but Patton’s consistency was lacking, especially in pre-November games.
That appears to be changing.
